conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the interval from 0 to 10 seconds, we need to analyze the velocity-time (v-t) graph and understand the relationship between velocity and acceleration.
Acceleration is defined as the rate of change of velocity with respect to time. Mathematically: a = dv/dt. The slope of the velocity-time graph represents the acceleration.
If the slope is positive, the acceleration is in the same direction as the velocity. If the slope is negative, the acceleration is in the opposite direction.
At t = 0, the velocity is v = 0 m/s.
As time progresses from t = 0 to t = 10 s, the velocity increases steadily, reaching v = 20 m/s at t = 10 s.
The graph shows that the slope of the curve is positive throughout this interval.

premise: The slope of the curve is positive throughout the interval.
conclusion: The velocity is increasing, indicating that the acceleration is positive during this time.

premise: The velocity is increasing and the slope of the graph is positive.
conclusion: The acceleration is directed downward, which is the same direction as the skydiver's motion (toward the ground).
The direction of the acceleration during the interval from 0 to 10 seconds is downward.
